page.title: 12Amenities in Brigstock
page.content: One football and one cricket pitch cover the sporting activities in the village. There are two telephone boxes two postboxes and three public houses, {The Olde Three Cocks, The Tavern, and {The Royal British Legion.}There is one primary school (there used to be three) and five shops including a betting shop, a frozen food store and a craft shop. There is also a Police house. There is the Parish Church and the United Reform Church. In the village square, outside the Tavern is a war memorial and a {Butter Cross.}On this spot the village people used to come to sell their dairy produce weekly. This was built in 1506 adn rebuilt in1706 and 1953. There are four buses a day to Corby.
